intro: Verbesina tonduzii, commonly known as the Congo sunflower, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Central Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its striking yellow-orange composite flowers. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers bloom in late summer and are composed of both ray and disc florets, attracting various pollinators. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
